title: Can we please do something about support brand?
body: Just lost tower 5 minutes due to brand facerolling his keyboard and taking me and the adc down to half health with one ability at level 1. How is his damage ok?

replies.body: "Can we do something about paper please? His gameplay is so OP, it's smothering to play against" - Rock

> [{quoted}](name=AtomicRadio,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=gZxpAm4e,comment-id=,timestamp=2018-06-19T15:48:11.091+0000)
>
> Just lost tower 5 minutes due to brand facerolling his keyboard and taking me and the adc down to half health with one ability at level 1. How is his damage ok?

If you can't anticipate what he is going to do and can't dodge skill shots which he has 2 of to really be effective then you are just not very good.

To be fair, a good brand can tag people with that W while they've stopped moving to auto a minion, and it's significantly easier to do at lower levels when the ADC doesn't have that much attack speed.

Not to say you should be getting dropped to half health alongside your ADC at the same time, but Brand does do a shitload of damage and is extremely powerful in low elo.

He's doing his job. 

The ADC needs to be more aware. Alot of people don't understand they can be punished for going for CS. You saying this tells me that you do know this.

Brand does tons of damage. Extra care should be taken when laning against him. Simply asking what the OP asked tells me the OP doesn't understand anything about Brand except that a good Brand will punish mistakes severely. They made multiple mistakes and because they did Brand was able to do his job well.

We're in agreement on most of that. My concern is saying: "if you can't...dodge skill shots...then you are just not very good." when you know that the easiest time to land a skill shot is when someone's CS-ing. 

It might be more accurate to say: "then you are playing against someone with better game knowledge..." instead of just putting the OP down across the board. We don't know anything about his mechanics or his ADC's mechanics... though I am wondering how a level 1 brand caught both the ADC and the Support in one ability if either one was paying attention.

If you dodged him ten times and did nothing to put him behind so he don't hurt you so much then you are a bad player.

That can be said about any skill shot champ. My point was that just because you can dodge him doesn’t mean he can have more base damage than comparable champs and still be balanced. Zoe is a good example, you can dodge her but she was overtuned. Now brand is a good champ to balance although there are others.

The sooner you understand that league is balanced around team play and not 1v1 the sooner you will realize you need to analyze your 1v1 before you act.
First it’s dodging now it’s teamplay. Every champ is countered by teamwork. That’s irrelevant to the topic of one champ having higher base damage than others.

I don’t know how to get through to you. Use all the ad hominem you want calling us crybabies but that doesn’t strengthen your argument. I’ll make it simple for you. Champ A does 1 damage with I stun in their kit. Champ B does two damage and has the same 1 stun utility in their kit. All things are equal besides damage. The answer to champ B isn’t to get gud or team play. The answer is to balance the game. You are something else man.

And you are still talking about 1v1.

Here I'll make it easy for you...

1+1+1+1+1=TEAM A

1+1+1+1+1=TEAM B

It is never CHAMP 1 versus CHAMP B.

If you lane against Brand and allow him to do this to you then you are failing your TEAM if you are playing a champ he dominates because you don't choose to play as a TEAM and prevent that from happening by playing safe until your TEAM can help.

As I said in a previous post, once you understand that you will understand what I mean by being balanced around team play.

Till then and probably always because you have shown to be that hardheaded, you will continue to whine and bitch about 1v1 interactions that in the big scope of things don't matter if you play them right.
